name: The Westin Beach Resort & Spa, Fort Lauderdale

reviews.text: A good 4 Star Hotel with prices of a four star hotel.
reviews.title: Expensive extras and missing on the extras

reviews.text: Plastic toothbrush glasses in a $600 suite is not OK.
reviews.title: Great staff, average accommodations

reviews.text: Nor is charging $17 per night for slooow internet. Per device!!! What year are they living in???
reviews.title: Lovely hotel for business trip

reviews.text: Or only offering valet parking.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: A feeling of trying to get your every penny.
reviews.title: Rip Off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think I am right to say that when staying at a beachfront location, the weather will always enhance your view and make things nicer. Therefore, I don't want to let the 'tropical storm' that we enountered when in Ft Lauderdale, cloud my review of the Westin.
reviews.title: Not bad for a 1 night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived late and were only staying one night, departing on a cruise the following day. The weather was awful, so we didn't venture outside again or see the pool etc.
reviews.title: Awesome Day Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was no problem, our room seemed to be far and away on the other side of the building, but never mind, we were just happy to have arrived.
reviews.title: Great Stay at The Westin

reviews.text: The room, overlooking the beach, would have been lovely if the weather nice. However, the rain was driving so hard against the sliding balcony doors, it was coming up under the seal and into the room, soaking the carpet I was too tired to call and have the room changed and lso aid towels down to absorb the water.
reviews.title: So helpful

reviews.text: The room and bathroom itself was nicely appointed, with nice amenities and decor. We had an interconnecting room, I noticed, (not sharing though).
reviews.title: Average or below average

reviews.text: Just returned from staying at the Westin while vacationing in Fort Lauderdale. Overall, this is a very nice hotel and the beds are indeed Heavenly.
reviews.title: Very nice experience....

reviews.text: The location is good, not great. Everything is within walking distance(5-10 mins). We are in our upper 20's so walking wasn't a problem. May be for an older group.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: The staff is what made the trip for us. I traveled down with my wife and 2 year old daughter and they made us feel right at home from the very beginning. The bellhop escorted us to our room and immediately ordered us a refrigerator and crib for the kid. Both items were to the room within 30 minutes. One day of our stay, housekeeping sent us a slice of cheesecake and chocolate cake up to the room. I must say that both were amazing.
reviews.title: Great stay and great staff
Nice location on the beach.
reviews.text: The pool bar workers, Rachel and Naomi, were awesome. Couldn't ask for better service. Also, Anka inside at the Shulas bar was great.

One downside (not a deal killer), is that there are tons of business people in and out of the hotel. I tended to feel a bit out of place at times going to and from the beach/pool in my trunks while amongst people dressed for business. There is no parking (from what I saw) at the side that most business events take place. Therefore, they all walk through the main lobby and pool area to get there. Also, the starbucks is near the business area so don't fall straight out of bed and decide you want a starbucks breakfast without putting on decent clothes.
reviews.title: REFRESHING AND RELAXING

reviews.text: This is our second stay in 5 months at The Westin Beach Resort and Spa. It is a great hotel with fantastic staff, we had an Ocean Front Room on the 8th floor which was spacious and kept fantastically clean by the housekeeping team. Although we had a couple of issues during the stay, these were resolved by the desk staff within seconds. Valet parking is a must as parking in Fort Lauderdale is scarce and expensive, pay the 25$ plus tax and be happy. I saw a number of cars getting parking tickets where people were trying to use the public parking system and fell foul of the 10 hour rule. We ate at Shula's for breakfast which was good but expensive. Looking forward to the next visit in March 2012.
reviews.title: Another great stay!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Westin last November (2010) for a work conference and I'm looking forward to going back again this year. This hotel is beautiful. The second story has a pool that looks over the ocean. There is also an enclosed walkway over the boulevard from the pool to the beach. My room had a king bed with the special bedding that makes for a good night sleep. Decor was modern and stylish. There was a great desk so I could get a little work done. I was on the south side of the building and could open sliding glass doors for a view of the ocean to the south. The only reason I'm giving this a 4 is the bathroom was small and there really wasn't much room for my travel case and grooming items.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: New Feeling But Strange Bathrooms and Poor Restaurant Service

reviews.text: The lobby and common areas of this hotel are among the best for the Westin brand. The lobby, fitness center, spa (I had a great 1-hour massage), and even the Starbucks are all modern, clean and well-maintained. The rooms are also modern feeling and ours had a fabulous view of the ocean.
reviews.title: Can't wait to stay again

reviews.text: Cons:
reviews.title: Loved this place, great value right on the beach.

reviews.text: I visited this beachfront hotel for a seminar and was happily impressed with the staff. Every staff member I passed in the hallways or in the convention area, without exception, smiled and greeted me, at any hour, each day. It was obvious, in a positive manner, that the staff was well managed and wanted to be sure that my stay was pleasant. Add to the fact that this hotel was on the beach and within a short walk of all kinds of eateries and pubs, and the rooms were clean and comfortable, I will no doubtedly stay here again.
reviews.title: Friendliest Hotel Staff

reviews.text: I went to the Westin as a Getaway with friends, the hotel was very busy, I found the staff efficient but not necessarily friendly. I had a partial ocean view room, the bed was 'heavenly', the window and door from the bathroom into the bedroom was a little weird, louvered slats, it meant the bathroom lacked privacy. The location was perfect, on the beach. Unfortunately the weather, while we were there at the end of February, was chilly, this made the pool and beach pretty to look at but not usable. Our room thermostat was not working correctly and we could not warm the room, we requested maintenance, the hotel informed us they did not have heat as normally they did not need it! The delivered us a room heater and complimentary hot tea, it was enough to warm us up. If the weather had been better, in my opinion the pool and lounge chairs would not have been sufficient for the size of hotel. On the last day I used the spa for a facial and massage. I arrived 30 minutes early to use the spa facilities. There is a whirlpool jacuzzi and steam room as well as a relaxation room. The relaxation room is very close to the pump of the jacuzzi, so while you're relaxing you have the thundering sound of the pump in the background, hence it wasn't so relaxing. The massage was amazing, I was looking for a gentle massage, not deep tissue and the masseuse delivered, I did not want it to end. In retrospect I wish I had had the massage and reflexology but that was my mistake.
reviews.title: Weekend Getaway

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel 3/5-3/6/13. Even though we got there early-- they got us in a room and gave us an ocean view as well. The front desk (Kelly) was so nice, she made our stay even better. The room was a corner room on the 14th floor with beautiful views on both sides. The room was large and nicely decorated. The bathroom was tile and marble with a wonderful "rainfall" shower head. Starbucks coffee in the room. Loved it would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Beautiful view

reviews.text: The location is terrific as it is within walking distance of many restaurants and shops. The rooms in my opinion are just average, considering the price of the room. If I paid over $200 a night in Vegas for a room, I could have a suite that was much nicer than my accomodations at this hotel. The food is just ok. They have a small sushi bar with a consolidated menu that I suppose will solve your sushi craving, but I just didn't think it was that great. Shula's on the beach is downstairs and my steak was overcooked. The rest of the meal was good. $28 a day to park your car (valet) as there's no self parking at the hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, overpriced

reviews.text: Very slow check-in, seems to need more customer counters and staff for busy check-in times. The room was very clean. The bed was very comfortable. The shower head, although a nice concept of seeming like you are standing in rain, needs more water pressure. The drain was slow so I was standing in water mid way through my shower. The carpet wasnt really appealing as far as newness or matching the room. The curtains could have used a serious dusting and when they painted the room, paint ended up on them. My room was next to the elevators which also had the bed against the same wall as the elevators. It sounded like wind against the window as you were in bed. Not too loud but noticeable. The onsite restaurant was too expensive but the food was good. The valet seemed to take a bit too long at times to retrieve your vehicle. I personally do not like paying to park at a hotel that you are staying in... even though it is common in such places it is still ridiculous! The staff was very friendly... as well as the valet staff...
reviews.title: Great location.

reviews.text: From the second I pulled in the staff experience was top notch, very welcoming, knowledgeable about the area, attentive, polite, and ready to full fill any task quickly. The rooms are nicely decorated and very relaxing. Their signature "heavenly bed" is exactly that, I got the best sleep I've ever had and I liked it so much im considering to buy the same bed. Room service was equally impressive very quick and the food was amazing. The roof top pool area is large with a few big cabanas, pool side dining, great bar with delicious frozen tropical drinks (try the key lime margarita), the pool is heated and open 24hrs. It also has a sky walk with an elevator directly to the beach. Starbucks, sushi bar and 5star dining available in the lobby with their very own Don Shula's restaurant. I also visited their "Heavenly Spa" it was classy yet comfortable and the services were rejuvenating and relaxing. There is nothing cheep about this hotel so prepare to spend but it is worth every penny. I've stayed in my far share of hotels and never felt compelled to write a review but I couldn't help my self that's how much I enjoyed it and I will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Best hotel I've ever stayed in..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was extremely clean and stocked, with all the amentities up to date this hotel is definitely a place I will stay at again. The staff is very nice and willing to help you with any thing you may need. You can't beat the bar right next to the pool and with a bridge connected straight to the beach, making this hotel one of a kind. I definitely enjoyed my stay here.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff, Relaxation at it's finest

reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights in February for a return visit to the Westin, having previously stayed here a couple of years back. My review was good then and nothing much has changed - it remains a high quality hotel, This time, I had a room in the tower that is set back from the road behind the swimming pool, which I guessed was the older building, but the room interiors were how I remembered them from my previous stay. Pluses are: great location; easy access to beach with sunchairs; great steaks in Shulas; having a chaise-longue in the room; cleanliness. It helps that the weather always seems great in this part of the world...Wi-fi is free in the public areas and was better than I remember from before.
reviews.title: Second stay underlines quality

reviews.text: As a 10 year Platinum member of Starwood Preferred Guest, I have had the pleasure to stay at a hundred or more SPG properties over the years and generally find the Westin brand to be tops for business travellers in many categories. Unfortunately, this Westin would have trouble competing for a spot on the lower end of the SPG chain hotels, although it charges on the high end. For example:
reviews.title: Not Your Average Westin (Unfortunately)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At check-in, we got nothing for our top status. No upgrades, no water view, no free breakfast (although you could use your standard amenity for a cheapo continental breakfast), no SPG lounge usage, no water view, and we weren't even placed on the SPG floor despite calling three days in advance to make sure we were accommodated for properly. The room we were provided was very small for the money and had filthy windows - although to be fair, the property is located on the beach. The room itself was generally clean, but the carpet was too scary looking to put my child down on to play. Again, beach-goers probably necessitate carpet cleaning / replacement more frequently. The room also smelled distinctly like mint-mouthwash - perhaps someone hoping to save on cleaning supplies??
reviews.title: Great location, nice, clean place.

reviews.text: We were eager to book this ocean-front resort for a business seminar and workshop. Upon arrival we waited for 5 minutes to at the under-staffed front desk to check-in and then were delighted to find out that our room was ready (3:00pm). We noticed quickly that our room had 2 double beds not a king as I had requested. I contacted the desk quickly and was told that 'yes, they knew that my room preference was for a king but room types are not guaranteed'. We estimated that we could tolerate the layout for 3 nights but were disappointed. The bathroom was nicely updated and modern as was the room but we looked out onto the rooftop A/C units and thus couldn't even open our window or sliding door for fresh air. It would have been a nice room for 1 person but cramped for 2 adults! Next time we'll be more careful and more thorough in our trip-planning.
reviews.title: It Was Good Enough!

reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night pre-cruise and it was amazing. We went for the beach front room which was a little more expensive but well worth it. We were in the building closest to the beach and had an exceptionally large NE corner room. It was clean and contemporary with the most amazing views, and we especially loved the view from the window in the shower! Room was equipped with glasses, wine glasses, bar fridge, desk, and 2 double beds with a large bathroom and dressing area There are no actual balconies, however patio doors slide open and this room has 2 patio doors (although one had a desk in front of it which we moved). I would have liked a 2nd sitting chair but this room only had 1. Service was superior from luggage, valet parkers and front desk. Workout room was good. There is a Starbucks on ground level which is very convenient for grabbing an early morning coffee before a long walk on the beach. We will be staying here again!
reviews.title: Amazing view of the beach

reviews.text: I was attending a conference being held in the Westin. I decided to arrive a day early, very early. I arrived at the hotel about 10:30 am. I inderstood a room wasnot available at that time. My phone number was taken and I was told I would be called once my room was available. good news since I had been awake since 3 am. well, 2:30 came around and I still have not received a call. I went to fromt desk and was told my room has been ready for some time....It is the begining and end of my complaints from my stay....The staff were helpful, the rooms were clean, location was close to stores and places to eat. The pool staff were friendly and quick to help find a chair to take in the sun. My room had an ocean view. which made for breathe taking sunrises and sunsets. I would go back in a second...
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hospitality and attention that my husband and I received from the valet parking, luggage helper, to the front desk, the restaurant and the room service was remarkable. This is the second consecutive year I stay at this hotel and continue to be my favorite.
reviews.title: beach front location

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 night during August 2011. We really liked the hotel and the facilities. The pool is elevated up and not on ground level which we really liked, it gives amazing views out over the Atlantic. The pool was clean, and with a great atmosphere around the place. Food and drink is served poolside, it was quite expensive, but really good quality.
reviews.title: Beachfront Location, Stunning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the Sheraton after having spent time in the Keys. I've read in trip advisor about the Sheraton and I realized there were mixed reviews but I expected that. The room we were shown was disgusting, it smelled so musty, the pool was a little green. When you closed the door to the room you could actually look out and see light around the frame. There was no way I was staying in this hotel and a lovely hotel employee tried to help when she saw how upset I was, I wish I got her name because she really did try and help. The did show us another room was was just as bad in my opinion. Needless to say we did not stay at this hotel, the hotel clerk got us a room at the nearby Westin which was a vast difference.
reviews.title: the room smelled of mold and mildew

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were nice, clean, however a little small. We thought our room had a ocean front balcony but it was just a sliding door with a railing on the other side. So you could open the room up, but you could go out and stand on a "balcony". I like Westin hotels, this one was great as well. Very nice pool, we ate at the poor bar and it was good- drinks were good also. The beach was nice, nice over the road walkway so you didn't have to deal with the car traffic when going to the beach.
reviews.title: Very nice- great pool.

reviews.text: 'Stormin The Doorman' was the icing on the cake to the very impressive staff at this Westin property. He made you feel like you were coming home as you walked through the front door. He turned us on to the best Greek Restaurant in town, and that isnt even his job! Outstanding service is hard to come by and was appreciated on our vacation. I would also recommend the spa, gym, and starbucks! All highend and spotless. Only negative was our very disappointing dinner experience at 'Shulas on the Beach', which is connected to this hotel. I look forward to my next visit to Fort Lauderdale and this property!
reviews.title: A Memorable Doorman Experience!

reviews.text: We stayed as a family with our 2 kids during this last summer. The hotel was in great shape, the staff was excellent, food was great, and the beach was awesome. The only setback was getting towels for the pool/beach, when you got them no one told you there was a limit of 4 day, so if you wanted a fresh one, you couldn't get it.
reviews.title: Excelent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel over Columbus Day weekend (10/8-10/10) 2011 for a short getaway. The first thing that I want to address is the "window" between the bedroom and the bathroom. I had read all of the reviews and I could not imagine what this was exactly, so I am including a photo of it with my review. In a nutshell, there is a "hole" in the wall between the bedroom and the bathroom which is only covered with a louvered door or California shutter. It does not afford any privacy whatsoever as far as "noise" in the bathroom whatsoever. So, my advice to you is if you stay here and you want privacy in the bathroom ask your room mate or spouse to take a walk for a few minutes or at least put the volume on the tv up high. There is also only a sliding louvered door to close the bathroom. (see photos)
reviews.title: Breathe Easy at the Westin Ft. Lauderdale Beach Resort & Spa

aka: The Westin Beach Resort & Spa, Fort Lauderdale Hotel
description: Our waterfront setting offers diving, sailing, fishing, or just quiet relaxation. But beachside bliss is only the start: we have a rejuvenating spa and fitness center and a serene oceanfront pool.
